description:
When a pregnant young starlet appears in Gorou Amemiya’s countryside medical clinic, the doctor takes it upon himself to safely (and secretly) deliver Ai Hoshino’s child so she can make a scandal-free return to the stage. But no good deed goes unpunished, and on the eve of her delivery, he finds himself slain at the hands of Ai’s deluded stalker — and subsequently reborn as Ai’s child, Aquamarine Hoshino! The glitz and glamor of showbiz hide the dark underbelly of the entertainment industry, threatening to dull the shine of his favorite star. Can he help his new mother rise to the top of the charts? And what will he do when unthinkable disaster strikes?

(Source: HIDIVE)

Note: Episode 1【推しの子】Mother and Children was pre-screened in advance in Japanese theaters on March 17, 2023. The regular TV broadcast began on April 12, 2023. The first episode has an extended runtime of ~82 minutes.
synonyms: เกิดใหม่เป็นลูกโอชิ

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Pregnancy
tags.description: Features pregnant female characters or discusses the topic of pregnancy.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Filmmaking
tags.description: Centers around the art of filmmaking.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Fake Relationship
tags.description: When two characters enter a fake relationship that mutually benefits one or both involved.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Bowling
tags.description: Centers around the sport of Bowling.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/akasaka_aka) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=3127667)

Illustrator for Vocaloid's [IA](https://anilist.co/character/187466/IA) and ONE. Aka Akasaka got his start as an assistant to [Jinsei Kataoka](https://anilist.co/staff/97888/Jinsei-Kataoka) and [Kazuma Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/97887/Kazuma-Kondou), the creators of Deadman Wonderland. His first serialized manga was an adaptation of the light novel series Sayonara Piano Sonata, published by Kadokawa in 2011. Kaguya-sama: Love Is War began serialization in Miracle Jump in 2015 but was later moved to Weekly Young Jump in 2016 due to its popularity.

In a Tweet on November 3, 2022, he announced his retirement from drawing manga. He will continue to work on authoring his current/future works.

__Favorite WSJ Manga:__ Chainsaw-man, Boku no Hero Academia, Agravity Boys, Jujutsu Kaisen

Mengo Yokoyari dropped out of high school to become a mangaka assistant. She had wanted to become a manga artist since she was little.

Yokoyari made her debut in 2009 with Maken☆H Zemi!, which was published in Magazine WOoooo! and later collected as part of the Mokkai Shiyo? compilation.

After contributing regularly to the magazine, she was invited by a Futabasha editor to draw a series for one its magazines. It would materialize as Haruwaka, Yokoyari's first serialization work.

She married someone from outside the manga industry on February 22, 2019.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yorimen) | [Pìxiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/75189) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yorip) | [Twitter (Her cat's twitter account)](https://twitter.com/ruttan627)

__[Website](https://www.yoasobi-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoasobi_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

__Introduction:__
YOASOBI is a Japanese music duo consisting of vocaloid music producer Ayase and vocalist Ikura. The group have released four music videos, all of which are based on short stories posted on Monogatary, a website operated by Sony Music Japan.

__Biography:__
Both members of Yoasobi had active music careers prior to forming the group. Ayase gained a following on the video hosting site Niconico since his first upload on December 24, 2018, a song titled Sentensei Assault Girl. On November 23, 2019, he released an EP, Yuurei Tokyo, which reached third on iTunes' album chart. Rira Ikuta, performing under the name Ikura, had already released two EPs: Rerise in 2017 and Jukebox in 2019.

The first song released by the duo was "Yoru ni Kakeru", based on Mayo Hoshino's short story "Thanatos no Yuuwaku" hosted on Monogatary. The music video was released first on November 16, 2019, where it broke 10 million views in five months on YouTube as well as being popular on TikTok. It was subsequently released as a single on December 15, 2019, where it topped the popularity charts on both Spotify and Line Music. More than five months after its release, the single would top the Billboard Japan Hot 100 on June 1, 2020.

Following the success of their first release, on January 18, 2020, Yoasobi released their second single, "Ano Yume wo Nazotte", this time based on Souta Ishiki's "Yume no Shizuku to Hoshi no Hana". On April 20, 2020, Yoasobi released a teaser for their third single, "Halzion", which is based on Shunki Hashizume's "Soredemo, Happy End". "Halzion" marked the first time that Yoasobi collaborated with a professional novelist, whereas the first two were amateur writers. The single was released as a promotional project by Suntory to advertise their new energy drink named Zone. The single was official released on May 11, 2020.

__Members:__
- [Ayase](https://anilist.co/staff/198948/Ayase) (あやせ) – composer and arranger
- [Lilas Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/199392/) (幾田りら), better known as Ikura – vocalist and lyricist

Note: YOASOBI also releases an English Version of their songs after the initial release of the Japanese version.
[English Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR48NTfP0M0OtpJgD2obWAuQF8yk0_F77) 
[Japanese Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR48NTfP0M0Nv3uFq7ka52rndi7_KJE41)
Affiliated with [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/Doga-Kobo). Sparsely worked as a production assistant earlier in her career.
